intro: Pritchardia forbesiana, commonly known as the Koa 'O Kāne, is a member of the Arecaceae family and is native to Hawaii. It is a tall, slender palm with a straight trunk and large, pinnate leaves that can reach up to 5 meters in length. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by black, spherical fruits that contain a single seed. It is adapted to grow in coastal and lowland areas, often found in dry, well-drained soils. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
